name: 2048.cpp
caption: A fully-featured terminal version of the popular game "2048" written in C++
details: Originally developed for my 12th grade course project, the game gained traction on Reddit and Hacker News. It was featured on GitHub's Twitter and Facebook accounts as well, thereby becoming popular overnight.

name: Refined Hacker News
caption: Browser extension: Hacker News, but refined ‚Äî Interface tweaks and features to make the HN experience better
details: This browser extension adds much-needed features, and tweaks a few stuff on Hacker News to make the browsing experience better... without changing the look and feel. The minimalist and raw design of the site is sacrosanct and should remain intact!

name: licensed
caption: licensed is an interactive command line tool to help you choose and add licenses to your projects
details: This project was one of my first attempts at creating a CLI tool and an npm package. It drasctically improved my understanding of Node.js and more abstractly, the opensource culture.

name: Markdown New Tab
caption: Browser New Tab: Save notes in Markdown directly in the 'New Tab' page
details: Markdown New Tab (MDNT) is a browser 'New Tab' page alternative that allows you to save notes, checklists, links, images, tables and everything that GitHub-flavoured Markdown [M‚Üì] has to offer directly in the New Tab page for quick access.

name: Sanskriti School
caption: The official website of Sanskriti School, New Delhi
details: In late 2017 I was given the responsibility of making my school a new website, solo. It was the first time I was handling a project of such scale, featuring extensive cross-browser testing, multiple revisions and beta-testers to ensure a uniform and accessible experience to all thirty-thousand of its daily visitors.
All in all, the entire project took almost a year to finish, primarily due to grade 12 studies and competitive examination preparations. The website was finally pushed to production in July of 2018.
